contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|icebreaker}} An '''[[icebreaker]]''' is a ship designed to move through ice-covered waters. '''Icebreaker'''('''s''') or '''Ice Breaker'''('''s''') may also refer to: * [[Ice Breakers (candy)]], a brand of mints and chewing gum * [[Icebreaker (clothing)]], a New Zealand clothing designer and manufacturer * [[Icebreaker (facilitation)]], a group facilitation exercise In '''film and television''': * [[Icebreaker (film)|''Icebreaker'' (film)]], a 2000 film directed by [[David Giancola]] * ''Ice Breaker'', a documentary film about the Canadian icebreaker [[CCGS Henry Larsen|CCGS ''Henry Larsen'']] * "Ice Breaker", an episode of ''[[The Crocodile Hunter#Season 5 (2002â€“2004)|The Crocodile Hunter]]'' In '''games''': * [[Icebreaker (video game)|''Icebreaker'' (video game)]], a strategy/action game * [[Ice Breaker (video game)|''Ice Breaker'' (video game)]], a 1990 computer game by [[Topo Soft]] * IceBreaker, an open-source clone of [[JezzBall]] In '''literature''': * [[Icebreaker (novel)|''Icebreaker'' (novel)]], a James Bond novel by John Gardner * [[Icebreaker (Suvorov)|''Icebreaker'' (Suvorov)]], a book by Victor Suvorov * ''Icebreaker: The Autobiography of U.S. Figure Skating Champion Rudy Galindo'', autobiography of Galindo co-written with [[Eric Marcus]] * ICEBreaker, in cyberpunk literature, a piece of software designed to break through [[Intrusion Countermeasures Electronics]] In '''music''': * [[Icebreaker (band)]], a UK new music ensemble In '''sports''': * [[Icebreakers]], a charity hockey team of Swedish NHL players * [[Chesapeake Icebreakers]], a defunct American minor-league hockey team '''Other uses''': * [[Icebreaker Glacier]], Antarctica * [[Ice Breaker Road Race]], an annual foot race in [[Great Falls, Montana]], U.S.A. ==See also== * [[Icebreaker International]], a UK new-music ensemble * [[Eisbrecher]], a German dance-metal band * [[Break the Ice (disambiguation)]] * [[Breaking the Ice (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
